basics.name: Dr. Feline Purrington
basics.label: Distinguished Professor of String Theory
basics.location: The Sunbeam on the Rug, Apt 4B
basics.bio: I am a **Tenured Professor** at the Institute of Advanced Napping. My research primarily focuses on *Applied String Theory* (chasing yarn), *Gravitational Anomalies* (pushing cups off tables), and the *Psychology of the Red Dot*. When not researching, I can be found judging you silently from atop the bookshelf.

interests: Box Topology (If I Fits, I Sits)

news.text: Narrowly missed catching the **Red Dot**. Further funding required for high-speed camera analysis.
Published a controversial op-ed: *'Why the vacuum cleaner is the enemy of progress'*.
Successfully slept for 18 hours straight. New lab record.

projects.title: Operation: Empty Bowl
projects.summary: An investigation into the human inability to perceive that a bowl is empty when the center is visible.

projects.title: The Box Paradox
projects.summary: A study on spatial geometry: demonstrating that a cat of volume *V* can fit into a box of volume *0.5V*.
